string_table.string: Use the w, a, s, and d keys to move around the 360 degree image. Press the tab key to jump to interactive markers and hotspots.
To preview this video, use the Preview functionality in Storyline, republish your course using standard MP4 video, or publish to Review 360.
Streaming video is unavailable for local playback.
You must complete the question before submitting.
Enter your name in the field below:

slidelink.displaytext: Temple Libraries Presents Using the Library Website
Stacks: Find item on the shelves
Remote storage or alternate campus: Request Item

search.slidetext: using the library website welcome to temple university libraries

understand the differences between library search and other library databases. use a library database to get relevant results efficiently. find full text articles on a topic. upon completion of this tutorial, you will be able to do the following: library search and other databases research guides ways to get help this brief tutorial highlights useful resources on the temple university libraries website, including: welcome to temple university libraries!

use the player controls to: adjust the audio; turn on or off closed captioning; pause, play, seek, or restart slide; and move to next or previous slides. in addition to using the < prev and next > buttons, you can navigate between slides using the left and right keyboard arrows. navigation instructions

in the center of the page is our catalog, the library search. ﻿you can use this search to find books, articles, videos, and more. you can search by title, author, or keyword. note that the page layout varies on mobile.
we’ll use the search box to search everything using the keywords “global warming”.
selecting a resource type, such as books & media, takes you to a second results page.
from here, you have a few ways of filtering your results even more. you can limit results by availability, date, author, and more.
results can be accessed from one of the following: bookbot stacks (4th floor) online remote storage or another campus

some books and most articles will have a link to an online version. under “availability” use any of the links under “online” to reach a pdf or html text version. note that the resource will open in a new browser tab.
the online resource loads in a new tab, where you can view additional details and access the full text.
the databases tab can be used to search for specific databases, or to browse either alphabetically or by subject.
by default, databases are listed alphabetically. select the “all subjects” drop-down to filter by subject.
let’s select the database academic search complete.
from here, you can search by keyword, or browse by course or subject.
our "sources for courses" guides provide you with the necessary materials and research strategies required for a specific class.

note that course-specific guides can also be accessed from the library link on your course canvas page. if your course does not have a course-specific guide, a general guide highlighting library resources will be available instead.

if you have more questions, the “contact us” tab provides you with multiple options. from here, you can live chat with a librarian in real time, make an appointment with a librarian, email, text, or call us.
the "search faqs" link at the bottom of the page is another place to search for answers to common questions.

this tutorial is now complete. use the submit button to exit or close the browser tab. follow the instructions listed to save your certificate. thanks! certificate certificate certificate certificate certificate certificate need a certificate of completion? select the button to access your certificate. looking for credit in suitable? select for additional instructions! please let us know what you think by providing your feedback! complete our 1-minute evaluation.

return return return return return return you left a field blank! please return and complete. tutorial certificate %tutorialname% type full name type course number please enter your full name and course number below to obtain your certificate of completion. save it to share with any course instructor who requires proof of completion.

this tutorial is now complete. certificate of completion %name% %quiz11.scorepercent%% %todaysdate% save save this certificate is presented to: for successfully completing %tutorialname% for %coursenumber%

slidetranscripts.slidetranscript: <Document xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"> <Content> <Block> <Style /> <Span Text="Welcome to Temple University Libraries online module! " /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Style FlowDirection="LeftToRight" LeadingMargin="0" TrailingMargin="0" FirstLineMargin="0" Justification="Left" LineSpacingRule="Multiple" LineSpacing="30" SpacingBefore="6" SpacingAfter="6"> <ListStyle ListType="None" ListTypeFormat="Parentheses" BulletFont="Arial" /> </Style> <Span Text="From the FAQs page, you can browse answers to popular, recent, and featured questions, as well as search for answers to your specific questions." /> </Block> </Content> </Document>
